heading: Soil Spectroscopy for Global Good
text:
SoilSpec4GG USDA-funded Food Agriculture Cyberinformatics
Tools Coordinated Innovation Network NIFA Award #2020-67021-32467 project. brings together soil
scientists, spectroscopists, informaticians, data scientists 
software engineers overcome current bottlenecks
preventing wider efficient use soil spectroscopy. series
working groups formed address topics including calibration
transfer, model choice, outreach & demonstration, use 
spectroscopy inform global carbon cycle modeling. info refer
: https://soilspectroscopy.org/.R tutorials software developed implement OSSL available via: https://github.com/soilspectroscopy.Soil spectroscopy global good project works global initiatives including FAO Global Soil Partnership IEEE P4005 Standards Protocols Soil Spectroscopy Working Group.

heading: OSSL mongoDB
text:
MongoDB Open Source noSQL DB hence fast fully scalable extendable
(affordable costs cloud solutions MongoDB Atlas similar).
TensorFlow cutting-edge ML algorithms can easily integrated served GUI.access OSSL DB best use mongoDB either graphical user
interface using Robo 3T, using mongodb via R.
following parameters (database credentials) allow ready access DB:Name: soilspec4ggAddress: api.soilspectroscopy.orgDatabase: soilspec4ggUsername: soilspec4ggPassword: soilspec4gg
Figure 0.6: Accessing OSSL DB using MongoDB GUI.
First, need specify parameters:Next, can initiate connection:now can query load data directly R, example get sample AfSIS1:
code:
library(mongolite)
library(jsonify)
source("R/ossl_functions.R")
soilspec4gg.db = list(
  host = 'api.soilspectroscopy.org',
  name = 'soilspec4gg',
  user = 'soilspec4gg',
  pw = 'soilspec4gg'
)
soilspec4gg.db$url <- paste0(
  'mongodb://', soilspec4gg.db$user, ':', 
  soilspec4gg.db$pw, '@', 
  soilspec4gg.db$host, '/', 
  soilspec4gg.db$name, '?ssl=true'
)
soilspec4gg.init()
#> [1] "Creating the access for mongodb collections."id = "icr006475"

heading: OSSL API
text:
OSSL API (Application Programming Interface) also available can used
construct requests fetch data, models generate predictions. outputs
predictions can obtained JSON CSV files, making system fully
interoperable. OSSL API moment based using plumber package
provided testing purposes . Users can calibrate maximum 20 rows
per request, limits gradually extended.
Figure 0.7: OSSL API available testing.

heading: Target variables of interest
text:
Soil spectral scan, calibration procedure, used determine various soil variables.
GLOSOLANâ€™s Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) list four groups soil variables interest international soil spectroscopy projects:Soil chemical variables:pH,Carbon,Phosphorous,Potassium,Nitrogen,Exchangeable cations CEC,Extractable microelements,Trace major element analyses,Gypsum,Electrical conductivity total soluble salt content,Soluble sulfate chloride analysis,Special analysis peats, mineral organic soils, agriculture forest,Soil physical variables:Bulk density,Coarse fragments,Particle-size distribution,Water retention curve,Porosity,Hydraulic conductivity function,Aggregate stability,Moisture content,Soil biological variables:Microbial biomass,Soil Respiration,Enzyme activity,Microbial identification,Soil contaminants:Heavy metal elements: , Hg, Cu, Cd, Pb similar,soil pollutants,list constantly updated. OSSL focus soil variables 
enough global calibration measurements fit reasonable models. Currently,
largest component OSSL USDAâ€™s KSSL data list 60 variables 
enough data fit calibration models.

heading: 2.4 Soil Spectroscopy software
text:
Open source commercial software used process soil spectral scans.
See also detailed review software used soil spectroscopy.
Even -depth review R packages used soil spectroscopy can found Wadoux, Malone, McBratney, Fajardo, & Minasny (2021).

heading: 4 Reference soil spectroscopy models
text:
reading work--progress SoilSpec4GG manual. chapter currently draft version, peer-review publication pending. can find polished first edition https://soilspectroscopy.github.io/ossl-manual/.following sections describe steps used produce OSSL models, 
used OSSL calibration service API. -depth insight 
modeling steps please refer ossl-models repository.

heading: 4.1 OSSL global soil spectroscopy callibrarion models
text:
fitted number calibration models using OSSL MIR VisNIR spectra
combination additional covariates, now publicly available
use CC-license. modeling use Ensemble Machine Learning
framework implemented R mlr programming environment
following parameters:Regression first 60 Principal Component Analysis PCâ€™s raw spectra;Four base learners: Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, Cubist Lasso Elastic-Net Regularized GLM;Ensemble Machine Learning stacking / meta-learner 5-fold Cross-Validation;Blocking using 100Ã—100-km spatial grid avoid possible overfitting;Feature selection model-parameter fine-tuning using random sequential backward search;details models fitted refer : https://github.com/soilspectroscopy/ossl-models.standard global soil spectral calibration models use various calibration frameworks including:Using MIR spectra calibration.Using VisNIR spectra calibration.Using combination MIR VisNIR spectra.Using combination MIR VisNIR spectra + geographic covariates.methods 1 & 2 standard methods described literature (Wadoux et al., 2021). methods
3 & 4 referred â€œMIR-VisNIR fusionâ€ approach (Vohland, Ludwig, Seidel, & Hutengs, 2022).
method 4 â€œfield-specific calibration approachâ€; refer 
â€œbundle approachâ€ basically use information available
help produce best predictions targeted soil properties.Users can choose opt one multiple calibration models, also
depends type data (VisNIR, MIR, coordinates depths known yes/) used course.
online callibration service (https://engine.soilspectroscopy.org) API
can used predicting values soil properties smaller datasets (<1000 rows).Soil spectral scans obtained different spectroscopic instruments often 
modeled analyzed together .e.Â require kind calibration (Lei & Sun, 2022)
one can fit cross-instrument / cross-dataset calibration models.
OSSL library thus use also instrument / dataset code indicator variable.
complex models currently OSSL , thus, one users need define :Input MIR spectra,Input VisNIR spectra (samples),Geographical location soil depth,Instrument code / dataset code;

heading: 4.2 Using default OSSL models to predict soil properties
text:
OSSL model registry (RDS) S3 file services currently includes large number 
prediction models fitted list soil properties. complete list available file OSSL_models_meta.csv.

heading: 4.2.1 Predicting soil properties using MIR spectra
text:
example, predict soil organic carbon weight percent (oc_usda.calc_wpct) using MIR spectra, need load
two models (1) principal component model mpca_mir_kssl_v1.rds,
(2) mlr model predicting oc_usda.calc_wpct:Note models (RDS files) can 10 200 MB size, depending complexity models
size training data used.Principal Component Analysis described OSSL models repository.
standard way compressing 1000+ spectral bands predictive modeling (Chang, Laird, Mausbach, & Hurburgh Jr, 2001).
use first 60 PCA components modeling, arbitrary decisions.can look summary model typing:shows model ensemble Machine Learning model based stacking 
four individual models: regr.ranger (Random Forest) (Wright & Ziegler, 2017), regr.xgboost (Gradient Boosting) (Chen et al., 2015),
regr.cvglmnet (Lasso Elastic-Net Regularized GLM) (Friedman, Hastie, & Tibshirani, 2010) regr.cubist (Cubist) (Kuhn, Weston, Keefer, & Coulter, 2012). RMSE
model 0.150 (R-square = 0.978), based 5-fold Cross Validation spatial blocking (global grid 100 km blocks).
Model based 72,246 training points.can take look accuracy plot model:
Figure 4.1: Accuracy plot log..oc_usda.calc_wpct/mir_mlr..eml_kssl_na_v1.rds.
Next, load sample MIR data can use predict soil organic carbon:simple table raw MIR spectral data (absorbances) prepared table.
column names contain wavelengths / MIR channels:can generate predictions using:ylim=c(0,100) specifies prediction values need range 0 100 (values range replaced either 0 100).
output model consists four parts:Predictions back-transformed value lower upper prediction intervals (1 std.);Data frame covariate layers needed generate predictions;Summary meta-learner predicted observed values;Ratio variance predictions produced using base learners MSE;predictions format:means predicted oc_usda.calc_wpct first row 0 etc. 
lower.1std upper.1std indicate standard prediction interval based 
prediction error derived log-space. higher values oc_usda.calc_wpct
